00013 /**
00014  * an entry in single linked list; 
00015  * If the user wants to link his struct(ure) into a SLIST linked list, then he must embed a DLIST_entry into his structure.
00016  * Access to user defined structure is via embedded SLIST_entry.
00017  */
00018 typedef struct tagSLIST_entry 
00019 {
00020   struct tagSLIST_entry *next;
00021 }  
00022   SLIST_entry;
00023 
00024 
00025 /**
00026  * @brief Single linked list data structure; where each list element can be of different length.
00027  *
00028  * This single linked list has a list header (SLIST).
00029  * The list header points to the first and last element in the list.
00030  * last elements next pointer is NULL.
00031  *
00032  * Usage: If the user wants to link his struct(ure) into a list, then he must embed a SLIST_entry into his structure.
00033  * Access to user defined structure is via embedded SLIST_entry.
00034  *
00035  * The list header contains a counter of elements (feature can be surpressed by defining #define SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00036  */
00037 typedef struct {
00038 #ifndef SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00039         size_t elmcount;   /** number of elements in list */ 
00040 #endif
00041         struct tagSLIST_entry *prev, *next; /** root.prev - pointer to first element,  root.next - pointer to last element */
00042 } SLIST;
00043 
00044 
00045 
00046 typedef void    (*SLIST_VISITOR_V)(SLIST *list, SLIST_entry *entry, void *context);
00047 typedef int32_t (*SLIST_VISITOR)  (SLIST *list, SLIST_entry *entry, void *context);
00048 typedef int32_t (*SLIST_COMPARE)  (SLIST_entry *,  SLIST_entry * );
00049 
00050 
00051 /**
00052  * @brief initialises an empty list head
00053  * @param head list head 
00054  */
00055 M_INLINE void SLIST_init( SLIST *head ) 
00056 { 
00057   head->next = head->prev = 0; 
00058 #ifndef SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00059   head->elmcount = 0;
00060 #endif
00061 }
00062 
00063 /**
00064  * @brief checks if argument list is empty
00065  * @param list pointer to list.
00066  * @returns not zero for non empty list.
00067  */
00068 M_INLINE int SLIST_isempty( SLIST *head ) 
00069 {
00070   return head->next == 0;
00071 }
00072 
00073 
00074 /**
00075  * @brief insert new entry after a given entry.
00076  * @param list pointer to list head
00077  * @param pos current posision (newentry inserted after this one).
00078  * @param newentry pointer to new list entry (to be inserted).
00079  */
00080 M_INLINE void SLIST_insert_after( SLIST *list, SLIST_entry *pos, SLIST_entry *newentry) 
00081 {
00082         if (list->next) {
00083 
00084                 if (pos){
00085                 
00086                         newentry->next = pos->next;
00087                         pos->next = newentry;
00088 
00089                         if (!newentry->next) {
00090                                 list->next = newentry;
00091                         } 
00092 
00093                 } else  {
00094                         newentry->next = list->prev;
00095                         list->prev = newentry;
00096                 } 
00097 
00098 
00099         } else {
00100 
00101                 list->next = list->prev = newentry;
00102                 newentry->next =  0;            
00103 
00104         }
00105 
00106 
00107 #ifndef SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00108         list->elmcount ++;
00109 #endif
00110 }
00111 
00112 
00113 /**
00114  * @brief delete an element from a list.
00115  * @param list deletes this list element
00116  */
00117 M_INLINE SLIST_entry *SLIST_unlink_after( SLIST *list, SLIST_entry *link ) 
00118 {
00119         SLIST_entry *ret;
00120 
00121         if (!link) {
00122                 ret = list->prev;
00123                 list->prev = ret->next;
00124                 if (!list->prev) {
00125                         list->next = 0;
00126                 }
00127                 
00128         } else {
00129                 ret = link->next;       
00130                 if (!ret) {
00131                         return 0;
00132                 }
00133 
00134                 link->next = ret ? ret->next : 0;
00135 
00136                 if (link->next == 0) {
00137                         list->next = link;
00138                 }
00139 
00140         }
00141 #ifndef SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00142                 list->elmcount --;
00143 #endif
00144 
00145         return ret;
00146 }
00147 
00148 
00149 /**
00150  * @brief insert element as last in list.
00151  * @param list list head.
00152  * @param newentry entry to be inserted into list
00153  */
00154 M_INLINE void SLIST_push_back( SLIST *list, SLIST_entry *newentry)
00155 {
00156   SLIST_insert_after( list, list->next, newentry );
00157 }
00158 
00159 /**
00160  * @brief insert element as first in list (used to maintain queue)
00161  * @param list list head
00162  * @param newentry entry to be inserted into list
00163  */
00164 M_INLINE void SLIST_push_front( SLIST *list, SLIST_entry *newentry)
00165 {
00166   SLIST_insert_after( list, 0, newentry );
00167 }
00168 
00169 /**
00170  * @brief append contents of one list onto the other
00171  * @param dest 
00172  * @param src  content of this list is appended onto dest list. postcondition: src list is empty
00173  */
00174 
00175 M_INLINE void SLIST_append( SLIST *dest, SLIST *src) 
00176 {
00177         if (SLIST_isempty(dest)) {
00178                 
00179                 if (!SLIST_isempty(src)) {
00180 
00181                         dest->prev = src->prev;
00182                         dest->next = src->next;
00183 #ifndef SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00184                         dest->elmcount = src->elmcount;
00185 #endif  
00186 
00187                         //SLIST_init(src);
00188                 } 
00189 
00190         } else {
00191 
00192                 if (!SLIST_isempty(src)) {
00193                         dest->next->next = src->prev;
00194                         dest->next = src->next;
00195 #ifndef SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00196                         dest->elmcount += src->elmcount;
00197 #endif  
00198                         //SLIST_init(src);
00199 
00200                 }
00201         }
00202 
00203 
00204 }

00207 /**
00208  * @brief remove the first element from list (used to maintain queue)
00209  * @param list (in) the object
00210  * @return the first element of list, NULL if list empty
00211  */
00212 M_INLINE SLIST_entry * SLIST_pop_front( SLIST *list )
00213 {
00214   return SLIST_unlink_after(list, 0);
00215 }

00218 M_INLINE SLIST_entry *SLIST_get_first(SLIST *list)
00219 {
00220   return list->prev;
00221 }
00222 
00223 M_INLINE SLIST_entry *SLIST_get_last(SLIST *list)
00224 {
00225   return list->next;
00226 }

00229 M_INLINE SLIST_entry *SLIST_get_next( SLIST_entry *cur) 
00230 {
00231   return cur->next;
00232 }

00237 /**
00238  * @brief Macro for iterate over all elements of a list, the list is traversed in forward direction from first element to the last element.
00239  * @param loopvarname (type SLIST_entry *) pointer to the current element
00240  * @param list (type SLIST *) pointer to the list that is traversed
00241  */
00242 #define SLIST_FOREACH( loopvarname, list )\
00243   for((loopvarname) = (list)->prev;\
00244       (loopvarname) != 0;\
00245       (loopvarname) = (loopvarname)->next )
00246 
00247 /**
00248  * @brief Macro for iterate over all elements of a list, the list is traversed in forward direction from first element to the last element.
00249  * @param loopvsarname (type SLIST_entry *) pointer to the current element
00250  * @param list (type SLIST *) pointer to the list that is traversed
00251  */
00252 #define SLIST_FOREACH_SAVE( loopvarname, loopvarnamenext, list )\
00253   for((loopvarname) = (list)->prev, (loopvarnamenext) = (loopvarname) ? (loopvarname)->next : 0;\
00254       (loopvarname) != 0;\
00255       (loopvarname) = (loopvarnamenext),  (loopvarnamenext) = (loopvarname) ? (loopvarname)->next : 0 )
00256 
00257 
00258 /*
00259  * @brief: return number of elements in list
00260  * if we don't have element count in list (SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT defined), then the whole list structure is traversed.
00261  */
00262 M_INLINE size_t SLIST_size( SLIST *list )
00263 {
00264 #ifndef SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00265         return list->elmcount;
00266 #else
00267         size_t sz;
00268         SLIST_entry * cur;
00269         
00270         SLIST_FOREACH( cur, list ) {
00271                 sz += 1;
00272         }
00273         return sz;
00274 #endif
00275 }
00276 
00277 /*
00278  * @brief get the nth element of a list as counted from the beginning of the list.
00279  * @brief list (IN) the object
00280  * @brief nth  (IN) index of element to retrieve (null based).
00281  */
00282 M_INLINE SLIST_entry *SLIST_get_nth( SLIST *list, size_t nth)
00283 {
00284 
00285         SLIST_entry *elm;
00286 
00287 #ifndef SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00288         if (nth >= list->elmcount) {
00289                 return 0;
00290         }
00291 
00292         for(elm = SLIST_get_first(list); nth > 0; nth -= 1, elm = SLIST_get_next(elm)); 
00293 #else
00294         for(elm = SLIST_get_first(list); elm != 0 && nth > 0; nth -= 1, elm = SLIST_get_next(elm)); 
00295 #endif
00296 
00297         return elm;
00298 }
00299 
00300 /*
00301  * @brief get the nth element of a list as counted from the end of the list.
00302  * @brief list (IN) the object
00303  * @brief nth  (IN) index of element to retrieve (null based).
00304  */
00305 M_INLINE SLIST_entry *SLIST_get_nth_reverse( SLIST *list, size_t nth)
00306 {       
00307         return SLIST_get_nth( list, SLIST_size( list ) - nth );
00308 }

00311 /**
00312  * @brief iterate over all elements of a list, callback is invoked for either element of the list.
00313  *
00314  * @param lst (in) the object.
00315  * @param eval (in) callback that is called to visit each set (or cleared) bit.
00316  * @param context (in) pointer that is passed as context on each invocation of callback.
00317  */
00318 M_INLINE void SLIST_foreach( SLIST *lst, SLIST_VISITOR_V eval, void *context)
00319 {
00320     SLIST_entry *cur;
00321 
00322         if (!eval) {
00323           return;
00324         }
00325 
00326         SLIST_FOREACH( cur, lst) {
00327                 eval( lst, cur, context);
00328         }
00329         
00330 }
00331 
00332 /**
00333  * @brief find an element within the linked list. callback is invoked for each element of the list, in forward direction from first element to last element; when the callback returns non zero value the iteration stops as we have found what we searched for.
00334  * 
00335  * @param lst (in) the object.
00336  * @param eval (in) callback that is called to visit each set (or cleared) bit.
00337  * @param context (in) pointer that is passed as context on each invocation of callback.
00338  * @param retval (out) optional - the first non zero value returned by eval callback, if NULL then ignored.
00339  * @return the list element that has matched (i.e. element that has been found).
00340  */
00341 M_INLINE SLIST_entry *SLIST_findif( SLIST *lst, SLIST_VISITOR eval, void *context, int32_t *retval)
00342 {
00343         int ret;
00344     SLIST_entry  *cur;
00345 
00346         if (retval) {
00347                 *retval = 0;
00348         }
00349 
00350         if (!eval) {
00351           return 0;
00352         }
00353 
00354         SLIST_FOREACH(  cur, lst ) {
00355                 ret = eval( lst, cur, context);
00356                 if (ret) {
00357                         if (retval) {
00358                                 *retval = ret;
00359                         }
00360 
00361                         return cur;
00362                 }
00363 
00364         }
00365 
00366         return 0;
00367 }

00370 /**
00371  * @brief insert new element into sorted list; Maintains ordering relationship between elements of linked list (sort by ascending order)
00372  * A sorting algorithm based on this function is not very efficient; it is of complexity O(n^2); nevertheless usefull if a list is modified and has to be always maintained in sorted order.
00373  * @param list (in) the object
00374  * @param compare (in) comparison function.
00375  * @param newentry (in) element that is to be inserted into list.
00376  */
00377 M_INLINE void SLIST_insert_sorted( SLIST *list, SLIST_COMPARE compare, SLIST_entry *newentry) 
00378 {
00379         SLIST_entry *cur,*prev;
00380         
00381         prev = 0;
00382         SLIST_FOREACH(  cur, list ) {
00383                 if (compare(cur,newentry) > 0) {
00384 
00385                         SLIST_insert_after(list, prev,newentry);
00386                         return;
00387                 }
00388                 prev = cur;
00389         }
00390 
00391         SLIST_push_back( list, newentry );
00392 }
00393 
00394 /** 
00395  * @brief iterate over all entries of the list and delete entries that match predicate from the list, and frees the memory (optionally)
00396  * @param list (in) the object.
00397  * @param check_if (in) predicate function; the function returns 1 then inspected argument element will be deleted; if argument pointer is NULL then all entries will be deleted. 
00398  * @param context (in) data pointer passed to every invocation of check_if
00399  * @param free_ctx (in) interface used to free data of entry, is argument pointer is NULL then nothing is freed.
00400  * @param offset_of_link (in) offset of DLIST_entry in embedded structure.
00401  */
00402 M_INLINE void SLIST_deleteif( SLIST *list, SLIST_VISITOR check_if, void *context,  int offset_of_link)
00403 {
00404     SLIST_entry *cur,*prev,*del;
00405 
00406         prev = 0;
00407 
00408         for(cur = list->prev; cur;) {
00409     
00410                 if (!check_if || check_if( list, cur, context))  {
00411 
00412                         cur = cur->next;
00413                         del = SLIST_unlink_after( list, prev );
00414                         if (offset_of_link != -1) {
00415                                 free( _MEMBEROF(del, offset_of_link) );
00416                         }
00417                         
00418 
00419                 } else {
00420 
00421                         prev = cur;
00422                         cur = cur->next;
00423                 }
00424         }
00425 }
00426 
00427 /** 
00428  * @brief iterate over all entries of the list and delete them.
00429  * @param list (in) the object
00430 
00431  * @param on_delete(in) if not NULL then this callback is called prior to deleting each list element.
00432  * @param context (in) if on_delete is not NULL then this pointer is passed as argument to on_delete.
00433 
00434  * @param free_ctx (in) allocation interface used to free data of entry.
00435  * @param offset_of_link (in) offset of SRING in embedded structure.
00436  */
00437 M_INLINE void SLIST_deleteall( SLIST *list, SLIST_VISITOR_V on_delete, void *context, int offset_of_link)
00438 {
00439     SLIST_entry *cur,*del;
00440 
00441 
00442         for(cur = list->prev; cur;) {
00443     
00444                 if (on_delete)  {
00445                         on_delete( list, cur, context );
00446                 }
00447 
00448                 cur = cur->next;
00449                 del = SLIST_unlink_after( list, 0 );
00450                 if (offset_of_link != -1) {
00451                         free( _MEMBEROF(del, offset_of_link) );
00452                 }
00453         }
00454 }

00457 /**
00458  * @brief Reverse a list
00459  * This function turns the first element into the last element, the second element
00460  * into the one before the last, and so on and on.
00461  * @param header (in) the object
00462  */
00463 M_INLINE void SLIST_reverse( SLIST *lst )
00464 {
00465         SLIST_entry *cur = lst->prev, *next;
00466         SLIST_entry *tmp;
00467         if (cur) {
00468                 next = cur->next;
00469                 cur->next = 0;
00470 
00471                 while(next) {
00472                         tmp = next->next;
00473                         
00474                         next->next = cur;
00475                         cur = next;
00476                         next = tmp;
00477                 }
00478 
00479                 tmp = lst->prev;
00480                 lst->prev = lst->next;
00481                 lst->next = tmp;
00482         }
00483 }
00484 
00485 /**
00486  * @brief check consistency of list
00487  * This function checks for loops in the list, and if count of elements in list is the same as counter of elements in list header.
00488  * @param header (in) the object
00489  * @return zero if list contains errors.
00490  */
00491 M_INLINE int SLIST_check(SLIST *header)
00492 {
00493         SLIST_entry *cur,*prev = 0,*fast= 0;
00494 #ifndef SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00495         size_t count = 0;
00496 #endif
00497 
00498         if (!header->prev || !header->next) {
00499                 if (header->prev || header->next) {
00500                         return 0;
00501                 }
00502                 return 1;
00503         }
00504         
00505         fast = header->prev;
00506         SLIST_FOREACH( cur, header ) {
00507 
00508 #ifndef SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00509                 count += 1;
00510 #endif      
00511                 prev = fast;
00512                 fast = fast->next;
00513                 if (!fast) {
00514                         break;
00515                 }
00516                 if (fast == cur) {
00517                         return 0;
00518                 }
00519 
00520 #ifndef SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00521                 count += 1;
00522 #endif
00523             prev = fast;
00524                 fast = fast->next;
00525                 if (!fast) {
00526                         break;
00527                 }
00528                 if (fast == cur) {
00529                         return 0;
00530                 }
00531         }
00532 
00533         if (header->next != prev) {
00534                 return 0;
00535         }
00536 
00537 
00538 #ifndef SLIST_NO_ELMCOUNT
00539         if (header->elmcount != count) {
00540                 return 0;
00541         }
00542 #endif  
00543         return 1;
00544 }
